You will be amazed to take one picture at full wide and another at full telephoto. The zoom range is so vast that you will be hard pressed to be able to see the item in the full wide picture. Sure, you can probably take a better picture with an SLR, but you would be spending a lot more money and have to lug around a larger camera. Also, the resolution at 12mp is great. You can crop away a lot of picture and still be left with something that can be printed and still look good.I also wanted to be able to shoot video and liked the idea of being able to shoot it at 1080p. I am not as serious about video but wanted to be able to shoot a good quality video now and again and the video does look good. I also used the software to extract a frame of the video into a still image, which is useful for a moving subject that you can't seem to be able to capture in the perfect pose. While the video frame is obviously not up to the same resolution as a still image, if you can't get the image otherwise, it is better than nothing and can certainly be printed in small size.A couple issues that I did not like but were minor:- The battery must be charged by leaving it in the camera and connecting a cable.  This is rather stupid, but the problem was solved by purchasing a battery and charger.  I was able to get two batteries and a charger for under $10, not Nikon name brand battery, but it is the same type of battery and it worked fine.- You have to remove the lens cap before turning the camera on, otherwise, the lens tries to extend and the cap blocks it.  This seems to be a common issue I have seen in other brands as well.- (ADDED POINT) There are folks complaining about the short battery life, and while this is true, a firmware update will correct the problem.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix P500 Rocks
Reviews.Author: G. E. Rosero "G.E.R.F"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and I used it for the first time at the U2 Concert. What can I say, this camera rocked. Awesome pictures. Awesome zoom, awesome panoramic feature The only downfall is that the battery did not last long enough 4 stars. So will recommend to buy an extra battery. cheers, G

Reviews.Title: great lens, slightly slow shutter on auto
Reviews.Author: J. A. Rake
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera which takes as good or better pictures in most circumstances than my Nikon digital SLR.  White balance is fabulous.  It does well in low light, too. Big sensor so plenty of resolution. Lightweight makes it a perfect travel camera. Fits easily in a travel bag or small backpack. So there must be a catch, right?  Well it doesn't deal well with sudden movement in the auto mode. But then again, what camera does. I am working on learning it still and think I will be able to conquer its flaws.

Reviews.Title: Donot buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Marvin
Reviews.Content: I have just returned my second camera for the same reason, the battery goes dead in the camera in less than 24 hours.I have visited the Nikon website and found I am not alone with this problem. I have replaced the battery in both camera's with original Nikon's and an aftermarket brand, they all go dead in the camera. There is definitely some wrong in the camera that is draining the battery.It is too bad Nikon is not addressing this problem, with a recall or a fix, because this is great camera, easy to use, super fast,with lots of great features,so unless you are prepared to buy an extra battery and have it charged and ready to use and are willing to change batteries every time you want to use the camera, wait until they correct the problem.

Reviews.Title: Clumsy to use - poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the Nikon Coolpix P500 is light weight (thanks to the proprietary batteries), easy to grip and wield,  and has a good lens cap.  The printing on the camera is very cheap looking but will probably hold up (and not rub off) over the long haul.  Battery life seems good.I found that the Nikon P500 was not a user friendly camera.  I had the following problems.(1) focusing - what the hell?!  Inconsistent and unpredictable focusingI focused on my hummingbird feeder approximately 40 times without making any camera adjustments in between shots.  About 5 times, the focus was sharp and the other times  the focus was off by a mile.(2) Focusing - what the hell?! Part IISame thing in the field.  I zoomed all the way out and focused on a butterfly and got a sharp picture.  Without making adjustments, I then tried to focus on a butterfly that was further away, but this time the image in the viewfinder was blurry and I got the blinking light telling me that I was too close!(3) Fuzzy ViewfinderEven after adjusting the diopter, it was hard to distinguish subjects in the viewfinder.  The viewfinder itself is small.(4) Multiple images - needlessly confusingThe multiple image button is oddly placed on top of the camera so you have to take your off the subject and  tilt the camera down to look for it.  When you press the button, too many options pop up.  This menu for taking multiple images is foolishly confusing.  At one point, I took multiple shots and didn't even realize it until after I looked at the photos on the computer.(5) Terrible viewing optionsIf you choose to look through the viewfinder, instead of the LCD screen, then when you go to Playback, the played back images only appear on the tiny viewfinder.  On my Canon SX10, the images are played back on both the viewfinder and the LCD screen, where it is easier to see them.Did anyone at Nikon ever try this camera out?(6)  Light exposure compensation.A turn wheel can be used to make choices throughout the camera menu system.  Except for light EV compensation  Here, you have to switch over to the cursor arrows.  If you try to use the wheel, it screws up the exposure.  Why the change in method? Again, did anyone at Nikon ever try this camera out?(7) Freeze up -If you go a few moments without taking a photo, the camera freezes up.  Sometimes you have try the zoom in/out lever several times or tap on the shutter button several times to get control back.  By this time, the subject has flown away!(8) Comparison I did a side-by-side comparison where I photographed the same 17 subjects with both the Nikon Coolpix P500 and the older Canon SX10.  Wow.  The Nikon images are larger (36X optical zoom vs Canon's 20X optical zoom), but otherwise the it's like day and night.  Canon's images are always sharper.  Sometimes, even though I thought that the image in Nikon's  viewfinder was sharp and the camera gave me the "go ahead" to shoot (no blinking light), the images turned out totally useless - blurry beyond usability. Only one photo shot on the Nikon is worth keeping.**************************Someone else wondered how this camera got a 4-star rating I have to echo his sentiment.  If you take general photos, such as landscapes and children and aren't too picky about quality, then it's an OK camera.  But if you want sharp photos of detailed subjects, such as close insects and far-away birds, this is not a good choice.  The older Canon SX10 out-performs the Nikon in ease of use and image quality.Someone had a good idea by  suggesting that you take a memory card to the store so you can try the camera and BUT  look at the images, at home, on your computer.  If the store does allow you to do this, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: EasyWild
Reviews.Author: john erb
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate & fast. Shoot wild grandkids & wild animals. With 36X zoom they don't even know you got them. Two granddaughters together on a walk, precious.  Grandson in midair catching a football as his brother trys to catch him, impresive. Squirrel on the seat of an unattended bicycle, whimsical. Candid moments that now will last forever, vivid, crisp, sharp. Wide angle gets the whole family at the big birthday party or all the grandure of a flock of egrets rising before the sun off a misty lake. My p500 is amazing. It works just like I expected, smooth and logical. I know how to shoot manual with the p500 but, like my car, I prefer to use automatic and enjoy the scenery. Thanks Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: D. Stoddard "Falas Quendi"
Reviews.Content: I've always been a super-compact/compact/small point-and-shoot camera person. I wanted to take a step up, but didn't want to jump straight into something with lenses and attachments. After looking around, and keeping price in mind, I came to this P500.I've been extremely pleased with this camera. I get great pictures with great resolution. Zoomed pictures have turned out great as well! The pictures I've taken have come out swimmingly (feeling lazy? no problem. The auto mode takes wonderful pictures. easy!). Makes my point-and-shoot cameras seem like dust collectors, since I want to use this at every opportunity. Though the ease of a super-compact camera fitting in a pocket is hard to beat.If you want a great camera that will take great pictures, but you don't want to go all-in for a super expensive camera with a lot of attachments, this is your ticket.Update: Over a year since owning this. I'm still happy as ever with it. Takes great pictures, and everyone that uses it, or sees the pictures is amazed and really likes it.

Reviews.Title: Great At First Look
Reviews.Author: dasmits
Reviews.Content: This camera has always had appeal to me for all of its great features and quality. It in general is a great camera but there are some flaws. I will not be able to account for all of them since I have not found all of them. A few of them are that even an 0X zoom, the edges of the photo still come out blurred or distorted. Sometimes the camera will just stop it's ability to take photos. On the bright side, the amazing 36x Wide Angle Optical Zoom gives you the ability to get  those shots from a distance, a good example is wildlife- you never want to get to close to the animal or else it would be scared and run off, this camera can allow you to avoid the problem. Also, the amazing two video features- High Definition and High Speed allow you to have fun with the camera in some other ways.Certain photos come out fine but be aware that the camera sometimes could go soft on you.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: bajoagua
Reviews.Content: This camera is all that is said 'bout it. 36x zoom is more than you can see bear sight. I even took to the theater to see the characters. Flash is strong enough, video and sound quality are great. Programs are usefull. Menus are comfy.  It has some drawback though:-Zoom is noisy. When recording a video if you zoom "on line" you'll get some important noise in your video. It's not a big deal of you're recording someone talking or that, but when shooting birds and so you won't like the noise.-Has no distance shooter. There's no way (besides timer) to shoot with a remote shooter, not wireless, nor cable. It would be nothing with my old Leica, but 36x zoom and a shaky hand will make you seem a lousy photographer. (Note: really recomend the use of tripode with these camera, if not it's great zoom con only be used in high light spots.-Can't use it while charging. If you buy an extra charger and battery you'll be OK.-Screen moves in one direction. Though its usefull to turn your screen to take pictures with your arms up, or when camera is on a table, you can't turn the screen to the sides.Anyway, any of these makes the camera a bad decision. Besides it's in good price.

Reviews.Title: I like the camera
Reviews.Author: Big Jim
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews available, I decided to buy the camera.  Most everything I read was true.  Great pictures, great zoom, and they printed very well.  I did find focusing at 36X to be a bit tricky especially in even slow moving targets.  I could understand this as I was trying to "find" the target.  At 36X (we were at the beach in Fla.), trying to get a fix on a subject with the waves and all it was kinda tricky.  However by pushing the button half way down, I was able to get a better fix and most of the pictures I took were very usable.  I would recommend this camera to any average "picture taker" like myself.  Again, there are improvements to be made, but based on other brands in this price range, the features on this Nikon were much better.

Reviews.Title: Love my Nikon!
Reviews.Author: Laura D "on line shopper"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since May 2011 and I absolutely love it! It takes great shots and is easy to use. It's lightweight and very easy to carry around either in a camera bag or with the neck strap. I always keep it handy since I never know when I might need it! I've not had any problems as described by other reviewers. The battery holds a charge very well and I've been recharging about once every 2-3 weeks. I'm using an Eye-Fi wireless wi-fi card Eye-Fi Pro X2 8 GB Class 6 SDHC Wireless Flash Memory Card EYE-FI-8PC and it works fantastic with this camera! I would certainly recommend this camera to anyone wanting a reasonably priced Nikon that takes beautiful shots!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Kindle 2nd Generation User
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a professional photographer but love to take pictures while I travel. I got this camera because I needed something with zoom and that would take clear pictures in all kinds of daylight. I've always had the Nikon point and shoot Coolpix cameras so thought I would stick with the brand and am happy I did. The camera is lightweight, easy to use and takes beautiful pictures - the zoom is ridiculous (pictures are still crystal clear)! This is a great camera for architecture and landscape photos, as well as for taking pictures of friends/family. I got the Case Logic case to go with it and it fits nicely. So far I have a 2 MB memory card with it from my old camera but hope to upgrade soon. Don't feel like you need to jump into buying a huge memory card right away unless you're going to take a lot of videos.

Reviews.Title: marvelous
Reviews.Author: Bet "gadget getter"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to be able to shoot baby egrets in a tree 100s of feet away and dozens of feet up. The 36 zoom put me right into their nests.  True, I still had to crop to the subject, but the resolution was so good that the resolution was still great even in the cropped image. Without the camera I never would've been able to be witness to the lives of these birds as they raised their young.The ability to slant the LCD viewing screen helped prevent an aching neck while pointing the camera high enough to capture the birds in their nests high in the eucalputus trees.That was why I got the camera, but the other features are fun, too.  The Scene setting for pets keeps shooting pictures as long as the shutter is held done so that the best one can be kept.  That's also good for shooting wild animals that keep moving around.  The selection for Portraits keeps shooting whenever it spots a smile.  Amazing.The controls are easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Taking the Next Step....
Reviews.Author: Fitz
Reviews.Content: This is the first 'non-pocket' camera that I have owned and I love it.  Was going to purchase the L120 but didn't want to deal with rechargeable batteries.  This camera takes amazing pictures for the price.  I bought the camera so I could take pictures of my new home (before and after pictures) and the quality of the pictures is so much better than anything you can take with the likes of a digitial elph.  I can't wait to take this to football games, family events, etc.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ray Gelinas
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Nikon DSLR for several years. I was looking for something that is easier to drag around on vacation. The Coolpix P500 is awesome. The zoom is four times longer than my 200 mm zoom lens I had to carry around with the SLR. The macro performs really well. That would also require lugging around a separate lens.I've been playing around with it for a couple of weeks and really love it so far. The battery doesn't last that long but it seems reasonable for what it has to do. I bought an external charger and extra battery for short money here on Amazon.It has amazing capabilities at any price but for $400 or so I think it's a bargain!

Reviews.Title: Great for a p&s;
Reviews.Author: John Foote
Reviews.Content: Had one for a week before I returned it to go with a dslr. But it worked well during that week!Pros: Zoom range. While the length of the telephoto is remarkable, the wide angle is even more amazing. You would need to spend this much for a lens for a dslr that is this wide.Picture quality is great. I could find no fault with any pictures except for the ones that were operator error!Easy to carry in a small package.LCD is amazing.Cons: shutter lag; I had a hard time snapping pictures when I wanted, not 1/2 second later.No way to attach filter. (This was a dumb one Nikon!)This would be a super travel camera; long range zoom, great pictures, long battery life, light but not cheap. I would have kept it but decided that a dslr would more fit my needs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, but could be improved
Reviews.Author: okiedokie
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera about a month ago.  Have been very pleased.  It takes FANTASTIC pictures.  The zoom and image stabilization work wonderfully.  I promise you'll be taking pictures and video you like you've never taken before.I've owned many compact digital cameras over the years.  Seems like none of them last more than a few years before they quit working for various reasons.  I guess electronics are just disposable these days.  Hope this Nikon lasts for a while, though.  Seems like a really nice camera.One thing Nikon could have done to make this a 5 star camera is to design it such that it accepts AA batteries.  I could not find replacement batteries for it at the local stores.  The EN EL-5 lithium battery that came with the camera must be charged inside the camera.  It's probably good for a few hundred shots, but the more you use the flash and the zoom the fewer shots you'll get.  I'd strongly recommend purchasing a few extra batteries and an external charger (where you don't have to charge the battery inside the camera).  I found several very economical extra battery & charger combinations here on Amazon, like Wasabi Power Battery and Charger Kit for Nikon EN-EL5, Coolpix 3700, 4200, 5200, 5900, 7900, P3, P4, P80, P90, P100, P500, P5000, P5100, P6000, S10.One more thing.  This isn't a small camera... it certainly won't fit in your pocket.  A padded case is a must for it.

Reviews.Title: P500 - It's okay, nothing special
Reviews.Author: akobet "akobet"
Reviews.Content: The most annoying is the blinding red light (for focus) that makes your indoor subjects cringe and beg you not to take a second shot.  The wife, the kids, the cat, non will pose for this camera twice.  It's like hitting the subjects in the eye with a red laser.  Mine came with the newer 1.1 firmware that doesn't seem to have any of the battery or SD card issues.  Good for me, as I was prepared to flash the firmware.  I shot over 200 pictures, mostly outdoor, maybe 10 or 20 flashes, and some HD video today, and the battery still shows full.  I enabled digital zoom in the menus, but I can't figure out how to actually use the digital zoom, something about twisting the control?  It's probably better that I can't digital zoom, 36x is good enough.  It's difficult to tell when you are not in wide angle and want that first 1x normal shot.  I thought I saw a little triangle once below the zoom bar to tell you it's normal, but the little triangle went away.  Focus is slow.  Pictures look great when viewed full screen on the computer, but only fair when zoomed to 100%.  No RAW, not that I ever shoot much RAW, but it would have been nice to see without compression artifact.  Although the 3 inch screen tilting looks great, the eye piece view finder resolution is not optical, poor electronic cam corder, and it looks like you're looking at a window screen.  When using the menu, it still sends the menu to the eye piece rather than the screen (or I wish it did both).  My AUTO pictures are fair or blurry, but switching into some manual overrides for shutter speed are pretty easy and improves quality.  Even with it's sensor VR on, blurry probably has to do with the absence of a lens stabilizer.  But it really ought to work in Auto well, but unfortunately the P500 falls short.  Manual focus is better than most compacts, I was able to use the left side zoom buttons, but it still feels wrong without a ring, like "drive by wire" the manual focus has no subtle feel.  The continuous shooting works pretty well, quick enough on "low" with good enough quality, but what is up with playing them back?  The Nikon treats the still JPG series like a video on playback, so doesn't tell you how many individual pics there are in the series until you click on "okay" to drill into the shots.  Outdoor shots are great, colors look fine, but I didn't but this camera just for outdoors.  This camera is supposed to do HDR, but HDR is not in the user manual's index or any menu I came across.  Not as obvious as, forgive me, the iPhone 4.  Maybe HDR is coupled with "a scene" or something ridiculous, who knows, I can't find it in the non-paper manual's index.  Overall I'm disappointed, if nothing else the Borg blinding red focus light puts the nail in the coffin, and I will return the Nikon P500.

Reviews.Title: Excellent zoom camera
Reviews.Author: Mary Joy Go
Reviews.Content: I was debating whether or not to get this camera or a canon sx30is, although the difference in optical zoom was only 1x, what really made me decide to get this camera was it's size and the image quality. I have to also mention the option to take panoramic pics on scene mode, love that function! I'm not a professional photographer so I use the auto mode a lot and it's amazing!! Really love this camera and glad i bought it.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: ariesara93
Reviews.Content: I got the camera for my birthday. My dad recommended it, he works in technology and knows his way around electronics so the fact that he bought it for me already says a lot about it.The wide angle allowed me to take a picture of the White House and it's garden without cutting anything off!The panorama option was great for taking  the whole Niagara Falls!And the zoom is sooo good! I took a very crisp and clear photograph of the moon.The camera is very versatile and I love it!You won't regret buying it

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, good pics, but...
Reviews.Author: M. Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I know this is a good camera, so I'm sure the problems i experience with it are user error or user misunderstanding...I needed to take quick pictures of whales in Hawaii, and there was too much lag time in between pressing the button. The girl sitting next to me was able to take multiple shots with one press of her button.  I pressed my button and took one pic, and I missed the shot of the whale breaching because it took too long to be able to press the button a second time.  I could not figure out how to get it to take multiple pictures with one click.  I have tried the sports setting and every other setting and read about it, but somewhere I am just "not getting it".  For just normal picture taking this camera is great.  I took some very close up pics of the full moon and I was amazed.  It looked like I was just a few miles away from it!  I know I need to look online and research my issues, or study my manual more. I'm sure this camera must have the capability to take action shots like I needed with the whales.  If it doesn't have this ability, then this is a major flaw with this camera. If you are considering buying it, find out from someone who knows more than I do if think you would like that feature.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and easy to use.
Reviews.Author: UniversityDoc
Reviews.Content: I must confess that I am not a professional photographer, nor a serious hobbyist. I just enjoy taking photos. I still use film camera, which I had long preferred and had used regularly until now. I like the convenience of being able to choose and pick photos from a digital camera, but I still think that real photographers use real film cameras. Digital photos can be manipulated; film photos are the result of a good photographer.My first digital camera was a basic no media card that cost $20.00. I next moved up to a 3.5mp camera, which was sufficient for a number of years.For awhile I had wanted to get a bigger and more powerful digital camera that had more options. I was thinking about getting a DSLR, but didn't want to spend so much money. I've been reading reviews about this line of cameras. Nikon Coolpix 500 received a number of positive reviews with a reasonable price. After considerable research, I decided on this camera and I must say that I am pleased with the purchase.It is easy to operate, almost idiot friendly, in fact, and has many options like smart portrait, night landscape, and manual. I love the telephoto lens that allows me to get close up shots of birds at my feeders or in the trees.  The camera makes great use of ambient light, which look even better when I use the flash. Sunset photos with telephoto, flash and night landscape are vibrant.I like the fact that when you forget to take off the camera cap, the camera reminds you to shut if off and remove the cap. Also, the cap can't be put back on into place unless the camera is off. I'm still getting used to and finding my way around the camera, but all in all, I'm quite happy with it.In the box with it comes a hard copy of the Quick Start Guide, which is all you really need, two CD's that contain a User's Guide, editing and photo software, cord for use as USB cord or with the AC plug. It also comes with a battery, strap and camera cap. It is energy savings and shuts off after a few minutes of non-use.It is better than a basic point and shoot, but not a DSLR. Overall, it is a nice compromise.

Reviews.Title: Lots to like in this camera
Reviews.Author: blasjas26
Reviews.Content: I'm still in my first month with the camera, so the story is not yet complete.  The 36x zoom IS incredible, and the "standard" pictures seem to comeout very well!  I DON'T like the fact that the instruction manual, all 250+ pages, is on a disc, so it is impossible without printing many pages of it to have the instructions with you when you shoot.  Soooooo many shooting options, most of which I have yet to "explore".  I'll have a better feeling for it in 6-12 months

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PASS THIS ONE BY
Reviews.Author: J. A. Davenport "DrTobor1"
Reviews.Content: Well, I see Nikon has finally delivered a camera I've been longing to own for years.  A camera that will give you 36x zoom and give you a picture on that zoom that does NOT LOSE quality, as long as you take the time to shoot the subject correctly.  This camera is feature loaded and in all my years of owning both film and digital cameras I can sincerely say I am most pleased with this model. Anyone who has used cameras for years will appreciate the simplicity of this one as well as the outstanding photo quality.  Without going into technical details, let me finish by stating if you are looking for a new digital camera that will NOT DISAPPOINT you, then the P500 from Nikon is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera, Excellent lens and Zoom
Reviews.Author: PCasp "Daddy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for under $300.  It is very well built, has excellent picture and video.  The camera has many high end features.  Zoom is awesome.  Great camera for taking family pictures.  Happy so far!

Reviews.Title: NIKKON P500 COOLPIX
Reviews.Author: Sis Porter
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this camera.  I can take pictures of things going on at the back of our lot, which is an acre, and it looks like you are standing right on top of it.  It will take pictures further away than that.  If you love to take candid shots and this is the camera. It also has a feature for when panning an audience, it waits for people to look up and then snaps them.  HOW COOL IS THAT for the evasive friend or relative that always looks down when they see the camera.  LOL  I was also pleased with the video. Very clear and vivid color.  I can't say enough good about this camera.  Got it really fast also.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, amazing zoom!
Reviews.Author: CylonCheese
Reviews.Content: First word of advice... if you already have this camera or are going to buy it, download the latest firmware update from Nikon's website. It will fix 99% of any battery issues or complaints.Plenty of features, easy to use, photo quality is great. I've also been impressed with the quality of HD video recording. I added a 32gb SD card and it stores a ton of pics and 1080p video.

Reviews.Title: amazing camera
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing! Better then i imagined it would be. Performs like a much more expensive camera and very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Not a Bad Camera at All!
Reviews.Author: Clow Angel "my thoughts, my memories."
Reviews.Content: I placed an order for the Nikon Coolplix P500 on Wednesday. It arrived today, just two days later with Amazon Prime 2-Day Free Shipping. Right out of the box, it was absolutely gorgeous. For a little something extra, I got the red one.Because my SD card hasn't arrived yet, I haven't taken more than a few dozen photos. For a non-SLR, the quality is pretty darn good. I haven't tried video yet obviously. The zoom is freaking amazing. I mean, I watched a bunch of test videos on Youtube and was impressed but having the camera in your hands and seeing it for yourself is mind-blowing.The Menu is rather blegh though. It has all the options you need of course, but the UI could use an upgrade.Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase. I'll probably update this review after I take it with me next week to the zoo for some wildlife photography.Edit: I still haven't taken it to the zoo yet, but my SD card came later that day. I've tested out night shots and HD video. Both turned out great. I'm loving this camera more and more. I read so many reviews that complained about being unable to take pictures in dim lighting, well, they were completely wrong. Hell, I took a picture in almost complete darkness with the stars as my only lighting, and the picture came out great.June 14th, 2011: Well, I returned from my trip to the zoo, and the pictures turned out wonderfully. Occasionally, the pictures can be a bit soft, but it's not something a few adjustments won't fix. I'm still learning my way around this camera to make it perform at its best though! =)Last night was a waxing moon that was nearly full, and I took it out to test its zooming capabilities. I can see the surface of the moon with this thing without using digital zoom. :o Dang those were some gorgeous shots. So overall, definitely not regretting this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Not for parents + kids
Reviews.Author: AdamR "Adam in Kentucky"
Reviews.Content: I don't dispute many of the positive things I've read about this camera.  The video is great.  The zoom is awesome.  Very user friendly camera.Problem is when I'm trying to photograph my family...lots of candids.  And of course kids tend to move unless they're asleep.  I've tried several modes and settings but don't have alot of luck getting good quality pictures.  I'd say I'm happy with only about 10-20% of the pictures I take, and those are usually when conditions are perfect (limited movement, perfect lighting, etc).  I won't argue with anyone who may say it might be more user error on my part, but I've had other, cheaper and less "endowed" cameras that took better pictures.If you're taking stills of nature, architecture, etc, I'd say this would be a good camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Bad Nikon experience!
Reviews.Author: Denise M Gambino
Reviews.Content: Camera does not come with a take along book of how to use and troubleshoot.  It comes with a CD to watch at home, but if you wish to have a portable guide to take with you the company refuses to provide one upon request.  They will tell you to print those hundreds of pages at home and bring them with you! They were very rude at customer service.  BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: A Great bargin.
Reviews.Author: Bluefox
Reviews.Content: I am glad I reviewed several camera's before I chose this camera. It was what I was looking for in a camera. It is easy to operate for a beginner yet it has the quality of a high-end camera. The zoom is handy in getting pictures of birds, animals, and people that you are unable to get with a point and shoot camera. The photo's I have taken are crisp and high quality. I am happy with my purchase and the price was what I wanted to spend.

Reviews.Title: battery
Reviews.Author: jg
Reviews.Content: the p500 is a great product -----BUT the battery is a problem---it is not holding a charge properly,,,  if u take it out of camera when not in use---great!! and of course carry a extra battery.  i would have like to have known about this battery problem before i purchased the p500,,  i have emailed amazon  and the 17th street camera store where it was sent from and have not heard from either????

Reviews.Title: 5 stars! The perfect camera for me.
Reviews.Author: Bernie
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the picture quality and the many features of this camera.  Nikon has a winner in this price range and Amazon got it to me quickly.If you take a lot of pictures, a 2nd battery is a must.  However, that is a small price to pay for the smaller footprint and lighter weight that would be lost with a larger capacity battery.The long zoom is fun to use and the quality of the picture is often unbeleavable without a tripod.The panorama mode works great and again the pictures are gorgous.

Reviews.Title: Awesome price to value
Reviews.Author: C. Rochefort "AppDevUser"
Reviews.Content: Side by side comparisons made this the best price to value camera available for people that want auto everything. Lots of directions and some are written in jargon that make it difficult to understand if you are new to photography. The video options and quality are great, and had no problem creating videos, however I did need a ripper app to make it iPad compatible. The sport scene was my most anticipated feature, but indoors, you cannot use the flash with it, and some of the pics came out blurry. I am still trying to figure out all of the settings and features, but all in all I am very happy with this camera. I especially like the user setting that I configured for black and white, which are super clear.  If you want fast speeds you do need to invest in the scxd card for speed writing, but that added an additional 150 to my price tag. Totally worth it.In auto mode, you can take pics quickly with virtually no thought required. Battery life is acceptable, I got about 100 pics and 10 videos of approx 4 mins each off of 1 charge, and since I am new to cameras in general, I am always reviewing the pics.I rate this high because I am very happy with it, but I do not have alot of experience with other products to say where it is better or worse than another.

Reviews.Title: Really Impressive
Reviews.Author: Karina
Reviews.Content: As some people here, I owned a simple point-and-shoot camera and was looking for a camera with a better zoom and also a nice macro, but not a DSLR. For two weeks I've been reading reviews, most of them annoyed more than helped, and in the end I decided to try P500. I received yesterday and today I'm taking some shoots. My main concern was the macro, as I didn't find many pictures of them online, and thinking that some people can be wondering the same I uploaded two pictures of flowers and one from a mantis. I still working on the macro to get the best details, especially with the insects, but I've got pretty happy with my mantis picture.I'll take some panoramic pictures on the weekend and then I post the images.As an amateur, I have a lot to learn with all the options this camera gives, but I'm pretty happy so far :).---During the weekend I went to the Franklin Mountains to take some panoramic pictures. The 180 is really nice, but the 360 is kind of weird, at least it was my first impression.I really enjoyed the scenes mode, the black and white is beautiful and sharp.

Reviews.Title: If you are going to take outdoor photos you should have a polarized lens, and this camera is not made for one.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Fan
Reviews.Content: A polarized filter is a must have filter for shooting outdoor scenery.  It makes the sky a deeper blue, takes reflection off water and snow and metal, and makes flowers and trees richer in color.Unfortunately this camera has no easy way to attach one.  I forgot about this fact when I made my purchase, so I have ordered a 3rd party adaptor to try and fix this problem.Right now my beach photos look nothing like I see with my polarized glasses on.I will update this review once I get my adaptor.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Paul Gennett
Reviews.Content: I went from a Konica Minolta Z3 to the P80, then the P100, and this is my second P500. My brother won't let go of his P100, and neither of us is interested in the newest models. GPS data? Who wants this government to know where and when you take your pictures? OK, GPS data is cool, great for cops and real estate agents, but I usually know where I am.I love the zoom and the wide angle. The adjustable screen is great for self timed and shots from the ground or above your head. I use the easy panorama function frequently, even though the resolution drops tremendously, but those are for snapshots I can send by email.However, Nikon makes some great compact cameras with surprising technology and features. I bought a $100 Nikon for my daughter and that has been ideal for her. It does chroma effects that even the P500 doesn't have. But that's what computers are for.

Reviews.Title: Great Performer Initially but died after 1.5 years
Reviews.Author: lavenderose007
Reviews.Content: LOVED this camera for the first year and half that I had it.  Took lots of amazing photos with it.  One day while on vacation photographing a flower it just died.  At first I thought maybe it was the battery although I suspected that wasn't the case since the lense wouldn't even retract.  Usually when a battery dies the lense will retract first.  I called Nikon support a few times and they were NOT helpful at all.  They were telling me it had to be the battery...I bought a new one - fully charged it and still nothing. Then they tried to tell me it had to do with the memory card...then they dared to tell me to go to Menu, Settings, etc....gee how can you do that when the camera is DEAD?  I ended up having to take it to an authorized Nikon repair place in Miami.  They weren't able to fix it so they sent it to Nikon in NY.  Naturally since I had the camera for 1.5 years it was no longer under warranty.  They had to replace the mother board and somethign else - cost me $175 and gave me a 6 month warranty.  I found this very disappointing.  When I purchased this camera new it was around $400 - you'd think you'd get longer than a year and half out of a camera at that price point.

Reviews.Title: USED
Reviews.Author: S. Nelson
Reviews.Content: This digital camera, advertised as NEW, ordered by me a week ago (March 2013) arrived to me with photos already on it of a family opening their Christmas presents dated 2011.  It is USED!  I'm disgusted by such unethical business practices.  Let's see how the company treats me as I try to seek a NEW camera or reimbursement of this USED purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect travel camera
Reviews.Author: Omar Simoza Chang
Reviews.Content: If you are going on a vacation, or a trip without proper environment for a DSLR, this is the type of camera you want to have. The zoom is absolutely amazing, nice wide angle and super telephoto, a bit noisy if you compare the pictures with a prime lens in a DSLR but you will be able to get nice quality for 8x10 prints with this baby. Light, perfect size for a woman's purse or a waist bag, backpack or something like that, many scene modes, auto is just OK, but manual capabilities will improve the pics of course. Battery life is very good, about 500 shots per charge, with the gorilla pod hybrid tripod will be a knockout duo for your next vacation.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera here, but not a DSLR camera
Reviews.Author: Stormy1
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased my first Nikon digital camera [the P500] here, have taken it out to take a variety of photos and decided to review this camera now.I wanted a "back up" digital camera to my Canon SX40HS digital camera with comparable zoom and capability of taking decent to very good photos, which the Canon digital camera sure does very well.Here is the good points I  have found on the P500 camera:Easy to use, decent-sized tiltable LCD screen, optical viewfinder, easy to use menu, good 36X optical zoom, very little shutter lag between pictures, easy to handle and pretty good photo quality overall.Here are the few bad points I have fuond so far on this P500 camera:Photos washed out on zoom, video quality so-so, no external battery charger with the camera and the long time it takes to charge the battery.Indoor photos comes out very nice with this camera. Outdoor photos comes in nice, but seems a bit dull or dark overall, but still very nice & sharp. I use AUTO mode for now and I have been and still am experimenting with various other settings with minor improvements in outdoor photo quality. Of course, this is not a DSLR camera and don't expect DSLR photo quality here. I can adjust photos I take here with computer software as I edit the photos taken with this camera. Photos using quite a bit of zoom has been somewhat "washed out" in appearance and I don't get that with other cameras too much except for this one and another Fuji zoom camera I had before. Now the 36X Optical zoom is quite good....just 1X more than my Canon. But my Canon does take a better picture overall than this Nikon camera, including with the zoom used, but still nice photos with the Nikon also, as long as you don't use too much zoom.I use class 8 or class 10 SD cards with this camera. I did use a class 4 SD card once and it seemed to work just fine also.Videos can be better, but overall, I guess it's fine. I do not attend to use the video feature on this camera much and never do with the super-zoom digital cameras as I have a compact camcorder for that job.Menu system on this camera is very well-organized and easy to navigate.....a nice plus for the camera.It does come with a Nikon rechargable battery....but NO external charger. I bought one external charger and 4 additional batteries for this camera. You can charge the battery inside the camera with the supplied connections to charge it up if you don't want to buy an external battery charger. Also, I have noticed it takes close to 6 hours to charge a battery up with this camera...using an external battery charger. So, I may buy another external battery charger for this camera. It only took maybe 3 hours to fully charge the battery on the Canon camera with their supplied charger.The camera is not too heavy, feels good to handle and has rubber handle grip and a rubber pad on the camera backside also, a nice feature. Easy to use camera for sure.So, to sum up what I think of this camera in a nutshell.....it's a decent easy to use camera, with a great optical zoom, takes good indoor and outdoor photos....as long as you don't use too much zoom and easy to handle.I would have given it more than a 3-star rating, but the zoomed photos being washed out, minor video issue, long battery recharge times, no external battery charger supplied with the camera....I will just give it a 3-star rating.If you want a good "super-zoom" all-in-one digital camera, this one is not too bad overall. You get good photos and a camera with lots of features on it for a decent price.I will probably update my review after I do more experimenting with manual settings. I hope this review helps some out there about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: RSETTIN "rsettin"
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-pro photographer. I know what I am doing and how to adjust a cameras settings to get the best picture available. With that being said, the focus is completely automatic and not adjustable. I use this camera primarily for sports shots and it is very frustrating to see the results. The photos are so blurry at times that I can not even tell who I am taking a picture of. I contacted Nikon and told them the blurry results in all areas using Sports Mode, Standard Mode, and Program Mode. There Response: "Try using Sport Mode." I informed them to read my email and they would see that I used Sports mode. They then asked me to reset the Camera. I did this and all the photos still come out blurry. After less than a year, I am throwing this camera away and never buying another Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Flawed LCD Screen & Poor Nikon Customer Service
Reviews.Author: cnguyen
Reviews.Content: My husband gave me a red Nikon Coolpix P500 for my birthday last May. I wanted a new camera that can zoom in close to take pics of our kids soccer and music events. I was happy with the camera overall. It does zoom in quite close but when you are at max zoom in, the pic is jittery and hard to take. Same with video at max zoom. So I usually back out some before I take the photo and that works pretty good. I like the sport event setting that takes up to 5 pics in a row which is very handy. The camera is easy to use which is good since I'm not high tech at all.So here's the downside. About 3 weeks before the 1 yr warranty is up. I noticed there were some vertical black lines on the right side of the LCD screen. I didn't think much about it; chalking it up to dirt on lens. So 2 wks later I decided to clean the lens. Well the lines were still there after so I showed it to my husband. You can guess what he said. He told me there's something wrong w/ the camera and we need to send it in for repair cause the lines will get worse and eventually the whole screen may go bad. Silly me huh? I told you I'm not techy at all. I realized then that we may have missed our window for warranty repair. And yes we did if we go by purchase date by a few days. Since I didn't get the camera until May 20, I hoped that Nikon would cut me some slack if I contacted them immediately. I did that and got an incident # so there's a record. I packed up the camera and shipped it off for repair.Long story short. Nikon said my camera has a cracked LCD screen and I have to pay $100 to get it fixed. This is because I missed the warranty date by couple wks. It doesn't matter that the problem first showed up during warranty and I would be within warranty period if they go by camera ship receiving date! I called Nikon service & support to get more explanation on how the LCD would get damaged since I kept it in a padded camera case. I didn't drop it or hit it against anything & the camera was less than a yr old to have a major component failure. The svc person was nice, promised to request a repair estimate review, etc. And I should get an email about the review request and hear from Nikon soon. I also asked for someone in repair to call me so I can understand better what happened to my LCD screen if the estimate is not going to be adjusted or waived. I gave her my cell phone #. No one called or emailed me. I called again yesterday, 6/5 and was told by a different person there was no record of my 5/29 call or estimate review request. I was also told that the LCD screen is very sensitive (whatever that means) and is not covered under warranty. I explained that I had the camera in a special camera case unless I'm taking photos. I was careful with it so I don't understand how it can be cracked. Anyway, she said she will request a repair review. She did but all it said was I called for a repair status which is NOT the whole story. I have no idea what will happen to the camera. I expect to pay to get it repaired. What gripes me is I expect better quality and service from Nikon.If the LCD screen is so sensitive then Nikon should warn buyers. Better yet Nikon should design it so it wouldn't be so sensitive or at least provide a hard protector lid/cap for it.In my opinion, if you have $400 to spend on a camera and you don't expect it to last more than 1 yr, then buy Nikon Coolpix P500. Otherwise buy something else that lasts longer and has better customer service support! I won't buy another Nikon camera. This is our second and we had problem with both! No more Nikon for us.

Reviews.Title: just great
Reviews.Author: Stephen Wells "Steve"
Reviews.Content: its a great camera and it fits very well with my needs! i have a Nikon cool-pix s9100 that takes great pictures/equal and gets to go 100% of the time because its pocket size but hard to take really good pictures with.  i have a digital SLR with 8 lenses but its too much junk for travel.  this camera is perfect for travel where your willing to put up with a bit more to get better pictures but you don't want the extra baggage an SLR requires.  its also better than the newer models with more telephoto!  the wider lens gets the whole picture and photo shop can make up for the difference in telephoto! if its not part of the image its lost foreveverI'm 72 and i was getting paid for taking pictures in the forth grade trust me the compromises Nikon has made on this camera are right on! its my best camera ever!

Reviews.Title: Questionable customer service - Not a great experience!
Reviews.Author: Gerry Franciosa
Reviews.Content: After doing my due diligence in reseaching cameras, my daughter (Christmas gift for her) and I decided on the Coolpix P500 - the features were very similar to a Canon and a Sony model but a bit cheaper.  You know where this will be going.Within a month the USB cable went bad and we purchased another.  Another month went by and the cable stopped working again.  We decided to send the camera back to Nikon.  I was presented with $105 repair estimate for a bad USB port.  Did I mention that the camera was less than 3 months old.  When I called customer service, I was told that I was given the estimate because I did not include the proof of purchase and that it should be covered. I downloaded the POP and was told that the supervisor was reviewing the estimate and I would hear in 1-2 business days.  2-1/2 weeks later and 4 contact attempts resulted in hearing that the USB port was damaged and I would have to pay the $105 repair.  2-1/2 weeks and I had to call.  Nice news - talk about being between a rock and a hard spot.  Can I prove the USB port is damaged - No. So what good is the warranty?  I had to "accept" their estimate or receive back an inoperable camera.If the experience I have had with this camera is an indication of future problems, I will see another camera in my future and it will not be a Nikon.Do yourself a favor, warranties aside, consider another option.  I will in the future.  Hope this gets to the Head of the Company.

Reviews.Title: Flawed Product
Reviews.Author: James W. Gerber "Jimmy"
Reviews.Content: Overall, this camera has a lot to recommend it.  It has a 36X zoom lens that starts at 22mm which is the main reason I bought it.  It's reasonably compact and except for a few major items is a good full featured camera.Here are my quibbles:I bought a 32GB PQI memory card and found it was incompatible with the camera.  Apparently, Nikon is not concerned about compatibility as they only support a handful of cards and won't update thye firmware to make it compatible with other cards.  I never had compatibility problems before and this card works perfectly with 3 Canon cameras I own and tried it on.I'm used to Canon and Casio cameras and this is my first Nikon.  I was surprised to find that the camera does not detect rotation and properly handle vertical pictures.  You have to correct the problem in your editing program by manually rotating the effected pictures.The LCD does not swivel completely (it's hinged and only swivels vertically) and is only useful for vertical pictures when using the hinge.  Also, it does not swivel 180 degrees like the similar Canon.There are some annoying software bugs that require you to reset the camera while shooting.  The Nikon web site says one was fixed in firmware 1.1 and my camera came with that firmware but I encounter the problem regularly.  After taking only a few pictures, the camera reports the battery is dead but when you charge it, it takes only 15 minutes or so to be charged indicating that it really was not dead.  I've lost several priceless photo opportunities.  Also, sometimes it starts up in the wrong mode and rotating the mode dial results in bizarre choices.  You have to remove the battery and restart a couple of times to get it back on track.The charger does not charge the battery while out of the camera.  I always carry a spare battery and would like to be able to charge the battery while continuing to shoot.All in all, I wish I had waited for the Canon SX40.  This camera seems rushed to market and Nikon isn't interested in fixing what's broken.

Reviews.Title: a good aniversary gift
Reviews.Author: Marco Antonio FC Ribeiro
Reviews.Content: Quality and price in a just balance. Superb zoom and very light. My wife new camera. She's in love with it.

Reviews.Title: I'm pleased.
Reviews.Author: Grace M. Dillon "Gracious"
Reviews.Content: Evidently I am hopelessly addicted to photography and I carry a camera with me at all times.  To shoot wildlife I find a dslr with lenses too cumbersome to carry and handle.I am happy with this purchase.  It's mega zoom is great for birding here in Florida, yet it's light weight enough to not tire me out.  Dealing with chronic pain pretty much curtails my activities, and lugging equipment is out of the question.  This camera serves me well.The boot up time really is swift.  I've timed it at just under 2 seconds.  Also when I shoot in succession, which I often do with birds, it fires up at a good speed.I have had a bit of blur when zoomed to the max, but maybe I just need to get used to it, and I didn't have the image stabilization on.The viewfinder is my preference when I shoot, and it seems to be accurate.  What I see is what I shoot.The tilt LCD is a great feature that I had on another Nikon.  I love it.  It's especially good for rising above the crowd, our getting down to low macro's, in the field.I'm looking forward to a bunch of good times with this camera.Oh...I had put it in my basket, but didn't have the money to spend yet.  I had been saving, but was still a bit short.  One day I received an email from Amazon telling me it was discounted that day.  I saved in the ball park of $80.  I was able to get it that day.  What a treat!  Thanks, Amazon!!!I must say, it was after praying "lord, I'd like THAT camera, and will trust you to make a way" that it went on special.  So along with thanking Nikon, and Amazon, I truly must thank my lord for making a way, where there was no way. Thank you, Jesus!

Reviews.Title: Great camera if you aren't ready for a DSLR
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: I am a very happy owner of this camera! After using the camera since Christmas, I am really getting the hang of the bells and whistles. At my job I use a DSLR camera and that is too fancy and heavy. The thing I really like about the Nikon CoolPix P500 is the fact it is lightweight and shots great shots! I took it to a NHL hockey game and the zoom is incredible, I could see the stitching on the jersey. I am very pleased. I also loved how the night setting photos turn out. We took a photo of our house at night with the Christmas lights on it and it was perfect.  I would highly recommend this!

Reviews.Title: It is really a great camera
Reviews.Author: edan
Reviews.Content: The zoom is fantastic, easy to use all features, and the quality of pictures is awesome but battery life could be better.I am in Galapagos Islands right now and I made pictures from long distance to birds and animals, also I took pictures to nearby targets with the zoom and the focus was really cool.I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Zooming out of the fog and into the daylight.
Reviews.Author: Gigsup
Reviews.Content: This gem of a camera was purchased not to take "coolpix" but to bring me out of the sshadows and into the sunlight.  With eyes sick with macular detgeneration, This helps me see much farther can than otherwisse  possible.  As an after thought,I even now take an acceptable photograph.  Thanks Nikon and Amazon.com

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: KaMBaM
Reviews.Content: I dont have a whole lot to add, I think most of it has already been said. I love the zoom, although it can get a little hard to focus without a tripod. Overall, it's a great addition to the other cameras I have.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Marcia Smith
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a trip to New Zealand because I didn't want to take my Nikon D80 for weight reasons.  The CoolPix took outstanding pictures.  The zoom feature is a little touchy -- goes too fast for me most of the time.  But overall, it was a great camera to have on a trip.  Not too bulky and has lots of functionality. Reviews.Title: Nikon COOPPIX P5000
Reviews.Author: Potter
Reviews.Content: This is simply an outstanding value with high level features at the best price around --- cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: FUN CAMERA!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: rosanne
Reviews.Content: I have so much fun with this camera i wind up taking hundreds of pix!  It goes with me everywhere, and I keep learning more things it's capable of! Reviews.Title: love it

Reviews.Content: love my new RED camera.  Takes great pictures and is easy to operate.Received it earlier than expected and took my first picture in about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality difficult to focus

I found however that focusing while in zoom was nearly impossible in any light My camera had a deffective lens and I had to send it back, Amazon was awesome and gave me a complete refund. Reviews.Title: Exceptional Camera
Reviews.Author: John A. Waszily
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera.  I have had it about a month and I am still experimenting with some of the features.  The quality of the camera and the resulting pictures is exceptional.  One of the features I liked and was important to me in buying this camera is the 36x zoom.  On the 4th of July, I set the camera scene mode to fireworks and proceeded to set the camera up on a tripod and aim it toward the fireworks display that was 5 miles away.  The pictures that resulted were amazing and looked as if I was a couple hundred yards away.  I printed one of the pictures out to a 13" x 19" and the quality was great.  A friend has a couple SLR's and couldn't believe the quality of the camera and pictures.  One draw back is that this camera doesn't accept any lens filters but elects to achieve some lens effects digitally.

I love my SLR, but there are times when simple, & still powerful with great options is good.  The camera fits well in my hand.  It's faster than my old Nikon compact.  If you're looking for a digital camera with alot of SLR options, this is the one to get

Reviews.Author: Faris M
Reviews.Content: pros:nice and small very high quality imagescons:this is my first time using a digital camera that is not a mobileso this was hard for me .

Reviews.Author: William C. Milo "Bill Milo"
Reviews.Content: I feel bad about not giving it 5 stars but the battery life is to short.  I have 4 batteries and two external  chargers.  So far I have only gone through three batteries in one shootPro: Great camera. I have filmed a wedding, baptism, (2)dance recitals and a surfer demonstrations. My pictures in the wedding and baptism were of professional quality.  Actuallly my work was better than the pros.  The dance recitals (grandchildren) were indors.  In these cases I  used the scene musem mode.  Unbleviable gread results.  I took HD Movies in the surfer mode and the results were great.  I always used at least two batteries and three during the surfer.  I believe you are supposed to get 30 minutes in video.  I don't believe it. I am very happy with the camera. Reviews.Title: No way to disable pre-flash
Reviews.Author: M. Homan
Reviews.Content: Great little camera but even when you set the camera to manual mode, there is no way to disable the pre-flash.  That is a big problem if you use external flash triggered strobes like I do that have no way to accommodate pre-flashes.  From Nikon support:"Thanks for contacting Nikon Tech Support.The least amount of flashes per shot is two, the first low power pre-flash is a monitor flash to measure the light and the second one is the complete flash for the picture. The first one cannot be turned OFF unless you completely turn the flash OFF.I hope you find this information helpful."Unfortunately that is a deal breaker for me which means I have to keep my D40x so I will have to sell this camera.  Otherwise, this is a great little camera!

Reviews.Title: great pics

Reviews.Title: Decent, but..
Reviews.Author: Bunnie
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for my birthday as soon as it was released in the US.  The main reason I was interested in the camera because of the amazing zoom range.  After trying to use this "amazing" zoom, I soon learned that is was IMPOSSIBLE to use the highest ranges of the zoom without a tripod or a completely still solid surface to rest the camera on.  I've also used my cousin's FZ-40, and one of the features that the FZ40 has that the p500 does not is that the FZ40 tells you what zoom you are at [i.e 2x, 10x, etc] while you have to guess with the p500.I was also a little disappointed in the image quality -- being that this is a Nikon, I expected top-notch images, but that's not always the case.  Indoor images often have odd colors, from my experience.  And it is not easy to quickly adjust the colors -- you have to go through the menu and put some work into searching for the setting you are looking for.  Then, when you are confused and wish you had a manual to quickly reference to help you find what you are looking for, you realize that the manual is on a CD -- so if you are not near a computer, you can't use it.The battery life is nowhere near that of my cousin's FZ40, and the fact that you have to charge the battery in the camera made me quickly purchase an aftermarket charge kit with batteries.  I got 2 batteries, the wall charger, and a car charger plug all for under $10 here on Amazon.  That kit is a lifesaver and I think I would be returning the camera were it not for this kit. I really don't use the video feature, so I can't comment on it. There are also a lot of other features that I am still learning to use.... but...If I had to do it over, I would let go of my emotional attachment and my "favoritism" toward Nikon and gone with the same camera my cousin has [FZ-40] instead.

Reviews.Content: This camera has been on a 9-day wedding cruise and wedding reception after getting home.  It has worked above my expectation.  The optical zoom was amazing.  I was able to read the car emblem from 300 yards.  The camera is very easy for a beginner to use, (my 81 year old mother, for one).  Having  a screen as well as electronic view finder was a godsend.  I had time to play with the more advance features and found them easy to use.  Only problem I have is toning down the flash.  It is way brighter than I'm use to on a digital camera.  Plan on taking more pix in the future.  PS: between the cruise and reception, I've taken over 1200 pix.  Love the camera and the color, I got the red one.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Camera, great versatility!!
Reviews.Author: David ten Brink
Reviews.Content: This camera was my "hanukkamas" gift from my wife. I had owned the Sony DSC-H2 for years until it finally quit focusing and it was time for a new one. I spent months researching and tried & returned 2 other cameras before finding this gem of a camera. First off, I'm not a "pro" photographer. I'm an architect and I use photography a lot as a tool so I know a bit but by no means am I a "pro".I originally gave Fujifilm's HS-20 a try. The camera had great picture quality and the easy panorama was terrific. However, the auto-focus was just awful. It was so bad that when I went back through picture I had taken during a family party I had to throw away almost half of the pictures because the came out blurry. It also weighed a ton. Noticeably more weight than my previous Sony DSC-H2 which is no pocket size camera either. The manual zoom barrel was good because popping in and out of a scene was very quick but making fine adjustments is really tough and its terrible for video mode. It has a manual focus ring but I found that to be junk. I won't even begin to bore you with how bad the video quality was.I returned the HS-20 and tried out a much cheaper model the Nikon s9100. That camera had a lot going for it, pocket sized, really outstanding user interface, and good pic quality, but I found the range of options was just too slim. Its obviously a camera better suited to more casual photographers that just want a good travel camera. If that is what you're looking for than I would recommend the s9100. Having just tried out the HS-20 though, I felt the sting of the downgrade way too much. So, again, I returned that camera and finally came upon the p500.I felt like Goldilocks in the 3 bears house!! The Nikon P500 was just right for me. The ultra zoom is really awesome, the 35x optical really gives you the freedom to get the pictures you want. The ultra-wide angle on the other side of the lens is also great. A lot of times I just don't have enough room to back out and frame the entire picture I want so having a very wide angle helps out tremendously. Picture quality is very solid. I think fuji's HS-20 may be better but only slightly. My brother has a VERY expensive dSLR Nikon camera (model??) which I compared pictures with and you really need a magnifying lens to tell them apart. Obviously the dSLR pics are better but at a huge difference in price and weight. Whenever he wants to use it he's got lug around this enormous piece of luggage that weight a ton. For the kind of "every day" picture taking I do its not worth it. The Nikon P500 is lightweight (relatively) and very versatile. It has enough user control that allows me to play around with the little I know about photography while not being overwhelming or over simplistic. Video/Audio quality is good, not out-of-sight but definitely passable.Only a few things left me wanting in this camera and that is: 1- The easy panorama mode is not quite as complete as fujifilm's hs-20. You have to be very delicate with it or it won't come out right. It works but it takes some practice in order to get it right. With the HS-20 I could just swing that sucker around and out popped a beautiful panorama, Nikon's is a bit more touchy. 2- I really wish they had integrated the circular control dial like the s9100's. It seems like such a little thing, a rotating control dial on the same menu button. And yet it was probably the most notable feature on the s9100. These aren't big gripes, more like wishlist type stuff.I've had the P500 now for over a month and I'm extremely happy with it. I just wish I had found it sooner!!

Reviews.Title: pictures come out too blurry and distorted
Reviews.Author: S54B32
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for over six months now, and have taken at least a thousand photos, several HD videos and slow motion videos. The camera is user friendly with its menus, buttons and controls. I use a 32GB memory card with this camera so it does support it. The battery charger failed one week after I received the camera *thumbs down*... I just use my cell phone charger and computer USB ports to charge the camera when I need to. The charger is simply a USB wall adapter with detachable USB cable.Two things that I don't like (a) the wide zoom angle distorts and blurs the picture around the edges, and (b) the camera can't focus well in low light. Sometimes the camera/lens will keep focusing and never be able to pick up the correct focus setting, even with indoor daytime lighting. Other than that, all other pictures came out great. If you've ever used an SLR class of cameras, don't expect this camera's focus time to impress you; it just takes too long in my opinion (sometimes over 3 seconds).If you're used to shooting simple videos with your cell phone, the HD video with this camera will stun you with clarity (it did to me anyway). I never had anything that could shoot slow motion video so this camera did a great job for my first time. The video is smaller resolution in slow motion, but you could still see amazing detail.Other than the cheaply made charger, I like the camera. It doesn't fit into your pocket so if you decide to walk around with it, expect it to hang around your neck the entire time or in a carrying bag.

Reviews.Title: Much more than a compact
Reviews.Author: Pablo
Reviews.Content: I used to have top of the hill compact cameras then a froend of mine showed me his latest alpha with all the telephoto lens and i wanted to drop all of my cameras, i am not the one who will be carrying large baggages for a trip so i wanted something more convinient, we both started searching some hybrid camera which is not too large or heavy but have the distinct type of photo DSLR cameras do, we search and searched, i found this camera is a medium path to DSLR, it is light, it is small for a good camera, has very good lens, has 1080 video, good quality display, and almost all the controls big camera have, you can change aperture or focus manually or even both to capture the moment, an addition is the 240 fps video which let you film high speed videos and then play them at normal speed, like discovery channel or animal planet when they show how a frog eats a fly in slow motion.It has lots of controls and has good stabilization for all zoom pictures, i am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I'm impressed with the picture quality and it does well in low light and fantastic in good light takes clear pictures and the image quality is amazing. Great camera, super fast, easy to use, lots of features, the zoom is phenomenal. Very good quality video with full 1080p HD,larg LCD Screen, does the job better than expected. Overall, the Nikon Coolpix P500 is pretty impressive an awesome Camera.

Reviews.Title: Time Lapse Photography is SEVERLY LIMITED & other things website reviews don't mention
Reviews.Author: NeoEngineer
Reviews.Content: Cons:-Timed interval shooting mode has a time limit of only 5 hours!  If you know what time lapse video or timed interval shooting mode is used for, then you know that 5 hours is a very short amount of time.  In fact, other cameras have no time limit at all and that's how it should be.  The only limit should be storage card space and battery.-No dedicated battery charger, the battery must be charged in camera via "USB".  Or, you have to buy an extra charger on Ebay.-Cannot power the camera via "USB," very strange that the "USB" port only allows you to charge the camera but not power it, say for extended shooting periods, like time-lapse photography...makes NO SENSE AT ALL!-Non standard USB port.  Come on Nikon, if you're gonna make us charge thru the USB port, then at least use a standard mini or micro USB port!  Instead, it's some weird USB port that I've never seen before.-Nikon's sensor IS (image stabilization) system is far inferior to Canon's optical lens IS system.-When recording video, Nikon's IS system doesn't even turn on.  Or else, it's so bad that you can't even tell that it's on.-If you just want to turn on the camera to view images, the camera will require you to remove the lens cap, even if you don't want to take any pictures.  The lens always protrudes out into a "ready" position when the camera is on, even if all you plan to do is view images on it.-Focusing is slower than Canon's USM focus system, which is on the Canon SX30 IS (this model's competitor)-Nikon's flip out LCD system is probably the WORST mechanism I've seen on any camera.  Why couldn't they just use a standard flip out LCD like everyone else?-No continuous zoom.  The lens will zoom up to 36x but the zoom range is not continuous.  In other words, it won't let you go from 1x to 2x, 3, 4x, 5x, 6x, 7x, 8x, 9x, 10x, 11x, 12x, 13x...etc up to 36x in "continuous" 1x increments.  Instead, when you press the zoom in button, it's like it skips to 6x, then 12x, then 18x, then 24x, etc up to 36x.  It's definitely not a continuous zoom range.  Quite a failure not being able to be able to use the awesome range of this zoom at a more fine range of zoom steps.-When recording video, it doesn't allow you to record at the widest length of the lens (ie, 22.5mm).  Instead, when you start recording video, the lens zooms in to about 30-35mm and won't let you zoom out.  You can test this by putting the camera on a tripod and then take a picture at the widest lens length.  Then, without touching the zoom buttons, start recording a video.  Then compare the zoome range between both samples.  The video always zooms in and doesn't allow you to do wide angle video recording at the len's widest range.-When changing the aperture, the aperture indicator flickers.  Not sure if this is just a defect with my unit, but it's annoying.-Please make the UI as easy as Canon.  I've used Sony, Panasonic, Nikon and Canon.  Canon, by far, has the easiest to use interface.Everything else about this camera is great and performs as well as lots of review websites have described.  But, don't let that fool you into thinking this is some "dream" camera, because it's not.  In fact, it's pretty far from it.  I really hope Nikon reads these reviews and fixes these MAJOR flaws.  I wanted to keep this camera but with so many flaws, I can't justify keeping it, especially at this price.  I plan to wait until Nikon or Canon makes something w/o so many bad design and functional flaws.  They will come around someday and the less we buy, the faster they'll come around.UPDATE:I just discovered that the time lapse feature on this camera is severely limited to time lapse sessions of 5 hours maximum.  I found a video on Youtube showing this limitation:www D O T youtube D O T com / watch?v=wP0ydmQMLNgIt essentially means that if you take a time lapse with 10min intervals, the camera will only capture 30 images, which is only enough frames for 1 second of video at 30 fps.

Reviews.Title: Help......
Reviews.Author: Love Nikon
Reviews.Content: Update:  I purchased the SanDisk Extreme HD Video 8 GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card SDSDRX3-8192-A21 as it met all the requirements in the owners manual.  Finally got an answer.... the  Coolpix P500 will not take a Sandisk memory card if it has the letter "I" in it.  Nothing in the description from Amazon nor in the picture showed the letter "I". So, I will have to go to a brick and mortar store and look at memory cards.Still can't rate the camera as I've got to go get a memory card._____________________________________________________________________________________________Prior post:Just got the Coolpix P500 yesterday so I don't have a review to write yet. Reviews.Author: The Murphs
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for several years. I don't like it. I was finally able to upgrade as this was very expensive. I think my old, normal point-and-shoot worked better. It is hard to get good pictures in less than perfect lighting. Yes, the different settings work well and I really enjoyed the macro setting. I got amazing print-quality work of flowers I used as artwork to stage houses. But people are a downfall. Most pictures of my daughter are blurry. The flash has to be on to attempt to get a clear shot with any motion. The video works well but again needs ideal lighting - and don't think about using HS for recording - no sound. Even if you can get the picture to normal speed with post-editing, the sound won't be present. If spending this much on a camera, I highly recommend saving a little more and getting an entry-level DSLR. The manual settings on this do not make it an "almost DSLR". Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX P500 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: This is my first entry into the digital era from the world of film photography.  A lot to get familiar with given the vast array of options this camera affords.  Image quality is generally good, though not tack sharp as I'm used to with my Nikon film SLRs.  Then again, this isn't a high end SLR.  What it does provide is a nice entry to more advanced digital photography than you can get in a pocket camera while still compact and light.  The large focal length range of the zoom in such a compact body is an invaluable feature.  I use it extensively shooting wildlife, to be unobtrusive, and to accurately frame photos the way I want them.  A major deficiency for me is lack of a hotshoe to enable use of alternate flashes and the ability to use a sync cord for off camera flash use.  I don't like being limited to small pop-up flash, which severely curtails effective flash photography.  Because LCD screens can be difficult to use in sunlight, Nikon has provided the ability to switch to viewfinder use, which is a great feature I haven't seen on other non-SLR digital cameras.  I am however a little disappointed in the image quality through the viewfinder.  Surprising for Nikon.  Still, it's a valuable feature I use all the time, not only in sunlight, but because of it's diopter adjustment, which helps me out when I don't have my reading glasses handy, which is the norm.  LCD image is sharp.

Reviews.Title: Mac OS 10.7 Will Not Recognize Camera
Reviews.Author: LTK
Reviews.Content: Overall, I'm not entirely pleased with this camera.  I bought it as a nice compromise between a bulkier DSLR camera and a smaller point/shoot.  However, I have found it to be super slow in manual, and I'm not pleased with the video quality- especially in low light.  Videos in bright light are fine but there are no adjustments for lower light indoor instances, such as a school program or Christmas morning.  The zoom lens, however, is spectacular and gives me the compact size I was hoping for while still being able to capture images that are far away crisply (as long as I'm outdoor, in sunlight), without changing lenses.  If I had to do it all over again, I might go with a Canon EOS Rebel or even a small canon point/shoot.Regarding the issue that many folks on online forums seem to be having with this camera and Mac OS 10.7+:I recently upgraded from OS 10.5 to Lion and my mac is failing to recognize the camera in iPhoto or in Image Capture when I connect it via a USB cord.  The only solution I have found is to plug the memory card into my printer and then import the images into iPhoto (or wherever) from either Image Capture or by importing them from the printer device files that appear under "shared" in my file menu (you can navigate there in iPhoto > file > Import to library > scroll to find printer ID in file menu (mine was a series of numbers under "shared") > printer file name > etc.
